text: Trevor James Hemmings CVO (11 June 1935Researcha.co.uk - UK Company and Company Director Reports - 11 October 2021) was a British billionaire businessman. He lived in the Isle of Man. Hemmings owned several race horses and the holiday company Pontins. He also owned Littlewoods, Blackpool Tower and had a Â£150 million stake in Scottish and Newcastle. One of Hemmings' horses, "Hedgehunter", won the 2005 Grand National at Aintree. Hemmings died on 11 October 2021, at the age of 86. == References == Category:Businesspeople from London Category:2021 deaths Category:1935 births
title: Trevor Hemmings
